solPicker.filters
Class FailScoreFilter

java.lang.Object
  solPicker.filters.Filter
      solPicker.filters.FailScoreFilter
Direct Known Subclasses:
HomoPolymerFilter
public class FailScoreFilter
extends Filter

This filter performs a series of operations on the oligos and assigns each a score based on these computations. Oligos with too high a fail score will be removed from the set. The user has the opportunity to designate a maximum fail score, but the programmed threshold is 10.

Version:
$Id: FailScoreFilter.html,v 1.3 2009/10/16 23:08:53 tizatt Exp $
Author:
Arjun Chandrasekhar

Method Detail

filter

public java.util.ArrayList<Oligo> filter(java.util.ArrayList<Oligo> oligos)
Takes an ArrayList of Oligos as a parameter and filters out all Oligos with a fail score that is greater than the specified maxmimum

Specified by:
filter in class Filter
Parameters:
oligos - the ArrayList of Oligos to be filtered
Returns:
an ArrayList of Oligos whose fail scores are all below a certain number

getTMScore

private int getTMScore(Oligo o)
Counts the occurrences of G and C nucleotides in the oligo's sequence. Uses the GC Count to calculate the TM score, adds 4 to the Fail Score if the TM Score is not between 81 and 77 inclusive.

Parameters:
o - The oligo from which to calculate the TM score

getHomoPolymerScore

protected int getHomoPolymerScore(Oligo o)
Checks for the presence of any homopolymers (subsequences of 5 or more consecutive identical nucleotides). Adds 11 to the fail score if there are any homopolymers that are 7 bases long or more; adds 2 to the Fail Score for every homopolymer that is either 5 or 6 bases long

Parameters:
o - the Oligo from which to calculate the Homo Polymer Score

fiveInARow

private boolean fiveInARow(java.lang.String poly)
Checks if a nucleotide sequence consists of 5 consecutive identical nucleotide bases

Parameters:
poly - 5 base nucleotide to be checked for the presence of a homopolymer of length 5
Returns:
whether or not the sequence parameter consists of 5 consecutive identical bases

sevenConsecutive

private boolean sevenConsecutive(java.lang.String poly)
Checks if a nucleotide sequence consists of 7 consecutive identical nucleotide bases

Parameters:
poly - 7 base nucleotide to be checked for the presence of a homopolymer of length 7
Returns:
whether or not the sequence parameter consists of 5 consecutive identical bases

getBaseFractionScore

protected int getBaseFractionScore(Oligo o)
calculates the percentage distribution of each different type of nucleotide base. If any type of base comprises more than 35% of the sequence or less than 25% of the sequence then the fail score is increased by 1
